title: Posit 2024 Great Table Contest - Spotify Dashboard
text:
For Posit PBCâ€™s Table Contest, I created an interactive Quarto dashboard that displays the â€œTodayâ€™s Top Hitsâ€ playlist from Spotify ğŸµ. The dashboard also includes an embedded Spotify web player, so you can hear the song directly in your browser! Although itâ€™s got an interactive dropdown menu, it didnâ€™t require a Shiny server â€“ itâ€™s all powered by Quarto + Observable JS + GitHub Actions + GitHub Pages. It updates itself automatically everyday at 9am, it was completely free to create and host, and it never needs to be run locally (unless you want to run it locally ğŸ˜‰). Below is a gif showing the dashboardâ€™s functionality:

ğŸ”— You can check out the dashboard by clicking the â€œMy entryâ€ page in the sidebar, or by clicking here ğŸ”— And the full documentation and tutorials for it, by clicking the â€œTutorialâ€ page in the sidebar, or by clicking here
I used the Table Contest as an excuse to teach myself some of the trickier concepts that have been on my â€œto learnâ€ list for a while now. Specifically, I wanted to learn how to create interactive dashboards that didnâ€™t rely on Shiny (I still â¤ï¸ Shiny, but I also love automation and learning new things), how to make gt tables interactive using the cols_nanoplot function, and how to safely store passwords / API keys / etc. for my GitHub projects and do authentication as part of GitHub Actions workflows.
I figured out the tricky bits, and I promise, itâ€™s not nearly as complicated as it sounds! Over the next couple of weeks, Iâ€™ll be posting 6 videos on my YouTube channel, explaining how to build this dashboard step-by-step, from scratch. Each video in the series is completely self-contained, so you donâ€™t need to watch the full playlist in order to follow along. Here are the topics Iâ€™ll cover, along with the day that each video in the playlist will be added ğŸ˜Š:

title: About Me
text:

Iâ€™m an accredited Associate Statistician (A. Stat.) and a Senior Data Analyst at Statistics Canada. I completed my M. Sc. in Statistics at Carleton University (2021), and my B. Sc. H. in Mathematics and Computing Systems with a Specialization in Statistics at Trent University (2019).
Iâ€™m passionate about all things Data Science and Teaching (and especially where those two things interact!). I make educational YouTube videos in my spare time (under the name â€œggnot2â€), covering topics such as R programming and Machine Learning.
Iâ€™m a co-organizer for the R-Ladies Ottawa chapter. If youâ€™re a gender minority interested in R or open source and youâ€™re in the Ottawa area, join us!
